QAPair.Question: What is (are) Ethmoiditis ?
QAPair.Answer: Ethmoiditis is an infection or inflammation of the ethmoidal cells in the sinuses. These are the air-filled spaces behind the nose and between the eyes. Ethmoiditis is a type of sinusitis .

QAPair.Question: What causes Ethmoiditis ?
QAPair.Answer: Bacteria cause most ethmoid sinus infections. Some types of fungus and viruses can also be involved.

QAPair.Question: What are the symptoms of Ethmoiditis ?
QAPair.Answer: Symptoms usually include: Headache between the eyes , Runny nose, Nasal congestion, Loss of sense of smell, Symptoms of more serious infections can include: Vision loss, Double vision, Redness or bulging of the eyes ,
